perturbation.original_text: e) Governing Law and Jurisdiction: The laws of the province of Ontario, Canada, govern this AGREEMENT and,  in respect of any dispute, which may arise hereunder; Agent consents to the jurisdiction of the federal and provincial  courts of Ontario, Canada.
perturbation.changed_text: e) Governing Law and Jurisdiction: The laws of the province of Ontario, Canada, govern this AGREEMENT; however, in respect of any dispute, the method of dispute resolution will be at Kallo's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies Ontario, Canada law and jurisdiction. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by stating Ontario law applies, but disputes will be resolved at Kallo's discretion. This contradicts the defined jurisdiction and potentially overrides legal processes, making it difficult to enforce the jurisdiction clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Jurisdiction and Dispute Resolution

perturbation.original_text: iv.Termination for "Cause" by giving 3 months written notice by the Agent or Kallo. If given by Kallo, "Cause"  shall be defined as non-performance on the part of the Agent by failing to make sufficient efforts to market  the Kallo Mobile care suite of products. Should the parties disagree as to what constitutes "sufficient  marketing efforts", the issue will be submitted to binding arbitration. This course of action is not intended to  be a means for
perturbation.changed_text: iv.Termination for "Cause" by giving 3 months written notice by the Agent or Kallo. If given by Kallo, "Cause"  shall be defined as non-performance on the part of the Agent by failing to make sufficient efforts to market  the Kallo Mobile care suite of products. Should the parties disagree as to what constitutes "sufficient  marketing efforts", the issue will be submitted to mutual discussion.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies binding arbitration if parties disagree on 'sufficient marketing efforts.' The modified clause changes this to 'mutual discussion', removing the binding arbitration provision. This makes dispute resolution less certain and potentially unenforceable, as mutual discussion isn't legally binding.

perturbation.original_text: Upon delivery of the system the Agent is responsible for getting the signed EULA from the customer before the  installation process starts.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon delivery of the system the Agent is encouraged to get a document from the customer before the installation process starts.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that the agent is responsible for getting a signed EULA. The modified clause changes this to state that the agent is encouraged to get a document. This contradiction makes it difficult to enforce the need for signed EULA before installation.
